verses.kjv: And when the people complained, it displeased the LORD: and the LORD heard it; and his anger was kindled; and the fire of the LORD burnt among them, and consumed them that were in the uttermost parts of the camp.
verses.web: The people were complaining in the ears of LORD. When LORD heard it, his anger burned; and LORD’s fire burned among them, and consumed some of the outskirts of the camp.
verses.ct: The people began complaining, and the LORD heard it. His anger burned hot, and fire from the LORD blazed among them, consuming people on the outskirts of the camp.

verses.kjv: And the people cried unto Moses; and when Moses prayed unto the LORD, the fire was quenched.
verses.web: The people cried to Moses; and Moses prayed to LORD, and the fire abated.
verses.ct: The people cried out to Moses, and when Moses prayed to the LORD, the fire died down.

verses.kjv: And he called the name of the place Taberah: because the fire of the LORD burnt among them.
verses.web: The name of that place was called Taberah, because LORD’s fire burned among them.
verses.ct: That place was named Taberah, because the fire of the LORD had burned among them there.

verses.kjv: And the mixt multitude that was among them fell a lusting: and the children of Israel also wept again, and said, Who shall give us flesh to eat?
verses.web: The mixed multitude that was among them lusted exceedingly; and the children of Israel also wept again, and said, “Who will give us meat to eat?
verses.ct: The foreigners who had joined them began craving other food, and soon the Israelites were weeping too, saying, "Who's going to give us meat to eat?

verses.kjv: We remember the fish, which we did eat in Egypt freely; the cucumbers, and the melons, and the leeks, and the onions, and the garlick:
verses.web: We remember the fish, which we ate in Egypt for nothing; the cucumbers, and the melons, and the leeks, and the onions, and the garlic;
verses.ct: We remember the fish we ate in Egypt — it cost us nothing! And the cucumbers, the melons, the leeks, the onions, and the garlic!

verses.kjv: But now our soul is dried away: there is nothing at all, beside this manna, before our eyes.
verses.web: but now we have lost our appetite. There is nothing at all except this manna to look at.”
verses.ct: But now we've lost our appetite. There's nothing to look at but this manna!"

verses.kjv: And the manna was as coriander seed, and the colour thereof as the colour of bdellium.
verses.web: The manna was like coriander seed, and it looked like bdellium.
verses.ct: The manna looked like coriander seed, with the color of bdellium.

verses.kjv: And the people went about, and gathered it, and ground it in mills, or beat it in a mortar, and baked it in pans, and made cakes of it: and the taste of it was as the taste of fresh oil.
verses.web: The people went around, gathered it, and ground it in mills, or beat it in mortars, and boiled it in pots, and made cakes of it. Its taste was like the taste of fresh oil.
verses.ct: The people would go out and gather it, then grind it in mills or crush it in mortars. They'd bake it in pans and make cakes from it. It tasted like something made with fresh olive oil.

verses.kjv: And when the dew fell upon the camp in the night, the manna fell upon it.
verses.web: When the dew fell on the camp in the night, the manna fell on it.
verses.ct: When the dew settled on the camp at night, the manna would appear with it.

verses.kjv: Then Moses heard the people weep throughout their families, every man in the door of his tent: and the anger of the LORD was kindled greatly; Moses also was displeased.
verses.web: Moses heard the people weeping throughout their families, every man at the door of his tent; and LORD’s anger burned greatly; and Moses was displeased.
verses.ct: Moses could hear the people weeping — family after family, each man standing at the entrance of his tent. The LORD's anger burned intensely, and Moses was deeply troubled.

verses.kjv: And Moses said unto the LORD, Wherefore hast thou afflicted thy servant? and wherefore have I not found favour in thy sight, that thou layest the burden of all this people upon me?
verses.web: Moses said to LORD, “Why have you treated your servant so badly? Why haven’t I found favor in your sight, that you lay the burden of all this people on me?
verses.ct: Moses said to the LORD, "Why have you brought this burden on your servant? What have I done to lose your favor, that you've placed the weight of all these people on me?

verses.kjv: Have I conceived all this people? have I begotten them, that thou shouldest say unto me, Carry them in thy bosom, as a nursing father beareth the sucking child, unto the land which thou swarest unto their fathers?
verses.web: Have I conceived all this people? Have I brought them out, that you should tell me, ‘Carry them in your bosom, as a nurse carries a nursing infant, to the land which you swore to their fathers?’
verses.ct: Did I conceive all these people? Did I give birth to them? Yet you tell me, 'Carry them in your arms, like a nurse carries a baby, all the way to the land you promised their ancestors.'

verses.kjv: Whence should I have flesh to give unto all this people? for they weep unto me, saying, Give us flesh, that we may eat.
verses.web: Where could I get meat to give all these people? For they weep before me, saying, ‘Give us meat, that we may eat.’
verses.ct: Where am I supposed to get meat for all these people? They keep crying to me, 'Give us meat to eat!'

verses.kjv: I am not able to bear all this people alone, because it is too heavy for me.
verses.web: I am not able to bear all this people alone, because it is too heavy for me.
verses.ct: I can't carry all these people by myself — it's too much for me.

verses.kjv: And if thou deal thus with me, kill me, I pray thee, out of hand, if I have found favour in thy sight; and let me not see my wretchedness.
verses.web: If you treat me this way, please kill me right now, if I have found favor in your sight; and don’t let me see my wretchedness.”
verses.ct: If this is how you're going to treat me, then just kill me now — if I've found any favor with you at all — and spare me from this misery."

verses.kjv: And the LORD said unto Moses, Gather unto me seventy men of the elders of Israel, whom thou knowest to be the elders of the people, and officers over them; and bring them unto the tabernacle of the congregation, that they may stand there with thee.
verses.web: LORD said to Moses, “Gather to me seventy men of the elders of Israel, whom you know to be the elders of the people and officers over them; and bring them to the Tent of Meeting, that they may stand there with you.
verses.ct: The LORD said to Moses, "Bring me 70 men from Israel's elders — men you know to be leaders and officials among the people. Bring them to the Tent of Meeting and have them stand there with you.

verses.kjv: And I will come down and talk with thee there: and I will take of the spirit which is upon thee, and will put it upon them; and they shall bear the burden of the people with thee, that thou bear it not thyself alone.
verses.web: I will come down and talk with you there. I will take of the Spirit which is on you, and will put it on them; and they shall bear the burden of the people with you, that you don’t bear it yourself alone.
verses.ct: I will come down and speak with you there. I will take some of the Spirit that is on you and place it on them. They will share the burden of the people with you so you won't have to carry it alone.

verses.kjv: And say thou unto the people, Sanctify yourselves against to morrow, and ye shall eat flesh: for ye have wept in the ears of the LORD, saying, Who shall give us flesh to eat? for it was well with us in Egypt: therefore the LORD will give you flesh, and ye shall eat.
verses.web: “Say to the people, ‘Sanctify yourselves in preparation for tomorrow, and you will eat meat; for you have wept in the ears of LORD, saying, “Who will give us meat to eat? For it was well with us in Egypt.” Therefore LORD will give you meat, and you will eat.
verses.ct: Then tell the people: 'Set yourselves apart for tomorrow, because you're going to eat meat. You've been weeping where the LORD can hear you, saying, "Who will give us meat? Life was better in Egypt!" So the LORD will give you meat, and you will eat it.

verses.kjv: Ye shall not eat one day, nor two days, nor five days, neither ten days, nor twenty days;
verses.web: You will not eat just one day, or two days, or five days, or ten days, or twenty days,
verses.ct: You won't eat it for just 1 day, or 2 days, or 5, or 10, or even 20 days.

verses.kjv: But even a whole month, until it come out at your nostrils, and it be loathsome unto you: because that ye have despised the LORD which is among you, and have wept before him, saying, Why came we forth out of Egypt?
verses.web: but a whole month, until it comes out at your nostrils, and it is loathsome to you; because you have rejected LORD who is among you, and have wept before him, saying, “Why did we come out of Egypt?” ’ ”
verses.ct: You'll eat it for a whole month — until it comes out your nostrils and you're sick of it — because you have rejected the LORD who is right here among you, and you've wept before him, saying, "Why did we ever leave Egypt?"'"

verses.kjv: And Moses said, The people, among whom I am, are six hundred thousand footmen; and thou hast said, I will give them flesh, that they may eat a whole month.
verses.web: Moses said, “The people, among whom I am, are six hundred thousand men on foot; and you have said, ‘I will give them meat, that they may eat a whole month.’
verses.ct: Moses said, "I'm surrounded by 600,000 men on foot, and you're saying you'll give them meat to eat for a whole month?

verses.kjv: Shall the flocks and the herds be slain for them, to suffice them? or shall all the fish of the sea be gathered together for them, to suffice them?
verses.web: Shall flocks and herds be slaughtered for them, to be sufficient for them? Shall all the fish of the sea be gathered together for them, to be sufficient for them?”
verses.ct: Even if we slaughtered all our flocks and herds, would that be enough? Even if we caught every fish in the sea, would that be enough?"

verses.kjv: And the LORD said unto Moses, Is the LORD’s hand waxed short? thou shalt see now whether my word shall come to pass unto thee or not.
verses.web: LORD said to Moses, “Has LORD’s hand grown short? Now you will see whether my word will happen to you or not.”
verses.ct: The LORD said to Moses, "Is the LORD's power limited? Now you'll see whether or not my word comes true."

verses.kjv: And Moses went out, and told the people the words of the LORD, and gathered the seventy men of the elders of the people, and set them round about the tabernacle.
verses.web: Moses went out, and told the people LORD’s words; and he gathered seventy men of the elders of the people, and set them around the Tent.
verses.ct: Moses went out and told the people what the LORD had said. He gathered 70 of the elders and positioned them around the Tent of Meeting.

verses.kjv: And the LORD came down in a cloud, and spake unto him, and took of the spirit that was upon him, and gave it unto the seventy elders: and it came to pass, that, when the spirit rested upon them, they prophesied, and did not cease.
verses.web: LORD came down in the cloud, and spoke to him, and took of the Spirit that was on him, and put it on the seventy elders. When the Spirit rested on them, they prophesied, but they did so no more.
verses.ct: Then the LORD came down in the cloud and spoke to him. He took some of the Spirit that was on Moses and placed it on the 70 elders. When the Spirit rested on them, they prophesied — though they didn't do so again after that.

verses.kjv: But there remained two of the men in the camp, the name of the one was Eldad, and the name of the other Medad: and the spirit rested upon them; and they were of them that were written, but went not out unto the tabernacle: and they prophesied in the camp.
verses.web: But two men remained in the camp. The name of one was Eldad, and the name of the other Medad; and the Spirit rested on them. They were of those who were written, but had not gone out to the Tent; and they prophesied in the camp.
verses.ct: Two men had stayed behind in the camp — one named Eldad and the other Medad. They were on the list of chosen elders but hadn't gone out to the Tent. Yet the Spirit rested on them too, and they prophesied right there in the camp.

verses.kjv: And there ran a young man, and told Moses, and said, Eldad and Medad do prophesy in the camp.
verses.web: A young man ran, and told Moses, and said, “Eldad and Medad are prophesying in the camp!”
verses.ct: A young man ran to Moses and reported, "Eldad and Medad are prophesying in the camp!"

verses.kjv: And Joshua the son of Nun, the servant of Moses, one of his young men, answered and said, My lord Moses, forbid them.
verses.web: Joshua the son of Nun, the servant of Moses, one of his chosen men, answered, “My lord Moses, forbid them!”
verses.ct: Joshua son of Nun, who had served Moses since he was young, spoke up: "My lord Moses, stop them!"

verses.kjv: And Moses said unto him, Enviest thou for my sake? would God that all the LORD’s people were prophets, and that the LORD would put his spirit upon them!
verses.web: Moses said to him, “Are you jealous for my sake? I wish that all LORD’s people were prophets, that LORD would put his Spirit on them!”
verses.ct: But Moses replied, "Are you jealous on my behalf? I wish that all the LORD's people were prophets and that the LORD would put his Spirit on every one of them!"

verses.kjv: And Moses gat him into the camp, he and the elders of Israel.
verses.web: Moses went into the camp, he and the elders of Israel.
verses.ct: Then Moses returned to the camp, along with the elders of Israel.

verses.kjv: And there went forth a wind from the LORD, and brought quails from the sea, and let them fall by the camp, as it were a day’s journey on this side, and as it were a day’s journey on the other side, round about the camp, and as it were two cubits high upon the face of the earth.
verses.web: A wind from LORD went out and brought quails from the sea, and let them fall by the camp, about a day’s journey on this side, and a day’s journey on the other side, around the camp, and about two cubits above the surface of the earth.
verses.ct: A wind sent by the LORD swept in from the sea, driving quail into the area around the camp. They covered the ground about a day's journey in every direction, piled up about 2 cubits deep.

verses.kjv: And the people stood up all that day, and all that night, and all the next day, and they gathered the quails: he that gathered least gathered ten homers: and they spread them all abroad for themselves round about the camp.
verses.web: The people rose up all that day, and all of that night, and all the next day, and gathered the quails. He who gathered least gathered ten homers; and they spread them all out for themselves around the camp.
verses.ct: The people were on their feet all that day, all night, and all the next day gathering quail. The person who gathered the least still collected 10 homers. They spread the quail out all around the camp to dry.

verses.kjv: And while the flesh was yet between their teeth, ere it was chewed, the wrath of the LORD was kindled against the people, and the LORD smote the people with a very great plague.
verses.web: While the meat was still between their teeth, before it was chewed, LORD’s anger burned against the people, and LORD struck the people with a very great plague.
verses.ct: But while the meat was still between their teeth — before they had even chewed it — the LORD's anger blazed against the people, and the LORD struck them with a devastating plague.

verses.kjv: And he called the name of that place Kibrothhattaavah: because there they buried the people that lusted.
verses.web: The name of that place was called Kibroth Hattaavah, because there they buried the people who lusted.
verses.ct: That place was named Kibroth Hattaavah, which means "graves of craving," because that's where they buried the people who had given in to their cravings.

verses.kjv: And the people journeyed from Kibrothhattaavah unto Hazeroth; and abode at Hazeroth.
verses.web: From Kibroth Hattaavah the people traveled to Hazeroth; and they stayed at Hazeroth.
verses.ct: From Kibroth Hattaavah, the people traveled to Hazeroth, and they stayed there.
